com.quantcomponents.core.model
Interface ITaskMonitor

All Known Implementing Classes:
TaskMonitorProxy
public interface ITaskMonitor

Abstraction for UI task monitors. To insulate the API from third party APIs, like Eclipse UI API, any task monitor coming from the user interface can be wrapped in an object implementing this interface, to provide the users with a way to interact with long-running tasks.

Method Summary
 void beginTask(int totalWork)
          To be called when the task begins
 void done()
          Call when the task is 100% complete.
 boolean isCancelled()
          Check the monitor if the task has been cancelled.
 void setCancelled(boolean value)
          Set the task to cancelled.
 void worked(int work)
          Task process: enter the number of sub-task completed from the last call of this method.
 

Method Detail

beginTask

void beginTask(int totalWork)
To be called when the task begins

Parameters:
totalWork - the total number of atomic sub-task in which the task can be subdivided

isCancelled

boolean isCancelled()
Check the monitor if the task has been cancelled. It should be called as often as possible during the execution.

Returns:
true if the task has been cancelled, false otherwise

setCancelled

void setCancelled(boolean value)
Set the task to cancelled. This can be called by the user to cancel the task.

Parameters:
value - true to cancel the task

worked

void worked(int work)
Task process: enter the number of sub-task completed from the last call of this method. E.g. if beginTask(10) has been called, then this method can be called ten times with the value of 1, or 5 times with the value of 2, etc.

Parameters:
work - the number of sub-task completed

done

void done()
Call when the task is 100% complete.
